image.altText: A woman sitting on a log wearing a brown top.

props.synopsis: The voices of those experiencing homelessness often go unheard. Meet three Canberrans who’ve found themselves sleeping rough. And while reasons for why differ for each, there's a common thread in how quickly and easily it happened.

title.children: 'All happened so quickly': Eileen is sleeping in her car at a Canberra park

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: Two teenagers died last year after a crash involving a stolen car on the Barton Highway, with the boy responsible today pleading guilty in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Teen pleads guilty after killing two people with a stolen car

image.altText: A screenshot of CCTV footage of an aggravated robbery committed by two people in black hoodies and face masks.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy is accused of committing aggravated robberies against two separate men in Canberra within the space of an hour.

title.children: Teenage boy accused of committing two aggravated robberies in one night

image.altText: Hume stands at a lectern, an Australian flag beside her.

props.synopsis: Shadow Finance Minister Jane Hume pointed to Stanford Research when arguing that working from home hurt productivity. That same research found working from home part-time actually saw productivity gains.

title.children: Arguing against WFH, Hume cites research that supports hybrid work

image.altText: David speaks into a microphone as supporters' signs wave behind him and a guy holds a guitar.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride challenges his jail sentence for distributing classified material to journalists over a ruling he says deprived him of a defence.

title.children: Jailed whistleblower David McBride appeals conviction

image.altText: boxing glove

props.synopsis: Some parents say they saw an almost immediate improvement in their children's self-confidence after starting martial arts. But it's not about using violence to address violence.

title.children: Frustrated with bullying, these parents enrolled their kids in self-defence

image.altText: A close shot of Dutton, wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says women looking for flexible work can find job-sharing arrangements, defending a Coalition promise to order public servants to return to the office five days a week.

title.children: Return to office order wouldn't disadvantage women, Dutton says

image.altText: Wild horses grazing in an alpine area.

props.synopsis: NSW Environment Minister Penny Sharpe has indicated that the wild horse management program at Kosciuszko National Park is ahead of schedule and that between 3,000 and 4,000 animals remain.

title.children: Brumby numbers 'way down' in Kosciuszko, aerial shooting paused

image.altText: A 10-year-old boy in a Ferrari cap stands on a karting track with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: While other Year 5 students are playing football or reading a book, Canberran Lazarus Añonuevo is turning heads on go-karting circuits around Australia and overseas in his pursuit to become a Formula One driver.

title.children: Canberra go-karting prodigy making Formula One dream a reality

image.altText: Image of two people, one claiming to be NSW Health worker, talking to content creator

props.synopsis: NSW Police charge a second Bankstown Hospital worker, Ahmad Rashad Nadir, over a video posted online that made threats against Israeli patients.

title.children: Second nurse charged over video threatening Israeli patients

image.altText: composite image of Elon Musk, Donald Trump and Mark Zuckerberg

props.synopsis: The uptick in showy displays of aggression and "masculine energy" across the heavyweight section of America's tycoon community is undeniable since Trump's return to power.

title.children: As Trump and his 'broligarchs' take over, reality disappears

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit, red tie, speaking into a microphone with an American flag in the background.

props.synopsis: In his first speech to the new Congress, Donald Trump declared his administration is "just getting started" before evicting a Democratic congressman from the chamber.

title.children: Trump says 'we're just getting started' as congressman evicted, others walk out

image.altText: A bearded man holds his hand to his forehead

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has offered an olive branch to US President Donald Trump, describing their fiery Oval Office meeting last week as "regrettable".

title.children: Zelenskyy says Ukraine ready to work under Trump's 'strong leadership'

image.altText: people on a jetty with a lighthouse at the end as waves crash over their heads

props.synopsis: Hazardous swells continue to develop down into northern New South Wales, with meteorologists predicting more coastal erosion in their wake.

title.children: 'Considerable erosion' leaves coast exposed to Cyclone Alfred flooding

image.altText: The side of a high-rise building with a pointed star logo with the words "The Star" below against a clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: Troubled casino operator Star Entertainment has barely enough cash to last until the weekend, increasing the likelihood of the company entering administration as early as Wednesday.

title.children: Star close to collapse with casino group set to run out of cash by Friday

image.altText: Justin Trudeau speaks at a press conference indoors.

props.synopsis: Justin Trudeau says further tariffs against American products will be introduced in coming weeks, labelling the trade war launched by Donald Trump as "dumb".

title.children: Canadian PM accuses Trump of using tariffs to make annexation 'easier'

image.altText: A woman with a tea bag.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation in Sri Lanka has found popular certification schemes are failing to live up to their ethical promises.

title.children: 'Not sustainable': The heavy price your 6c tea bag is exacting on others

image.altText: Two middle-aged men, one in a tight, olive green shirt and the other in a suit, shake hands in front of a woooden wall.

props.synopsis: The prime minister's offer to consider sending peacekeeping troops to Ukraine if a request is made has sparked warnings about Australia's capacity to assist with a major new military deployment.

title.children: Doubts raised over Australia's capacity to help with peacekeeping in Ukraine

image.altText: A high school student poses with her mobile showing her social media applications.

props.synopsis: The federal government has been accused of making a "sweetheart deal" to exempt YouTube from the teen social media ban, as YouTube's competitors kick off a co-ordinated public campaign against the move.

title.children: 'Banning soft drink and exempting Coke': YouTube's rivals slam draft ban

image.altText: A human in a bunny suit with blue gloves tests a sample on a rock in front of an endless sea of penguins on a rocky island.

props.synopsis: The deadly H5N1 strain of bird flu travelled 6,600 kilometres over the sea to Kerguelen Island, which is just 440km from Australia's Heard Island.

title.children: Deadly bird flu on remote island poses new threat to Australia

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A woman standing outside of a caravan wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Recent research by the Grattan Institute has found the number of older Australians unable to afford rent is growing, and women are disproportionately affected.

title.children: Australia's hidden homeless seek shelter outside the system

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: Australia's economy has broken out of a 21-month per capita recession, but the Australian share market has fallen again, following a continued sell-off on Wall Street as the Trump administration's trade war against China, Mexico and Canada ramps up. Follow live.

title.children: GDP rises, but ASX falls on Trump tariff concerns

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX closes at lowest level so far this year
Is Australia really that exposed to US tariffs?
ASX slides to lowest level since December ahead of Trump address

image.altText: JD Vance speaks from behind a lectern with a US flag behind him.

props.synopsis: When JD Vance clashed with Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a meeting with him and Donald Trump in the Oval Office, it was the culmination of a years-long campaign the vice-president has waged against giving more money and assistance to Ukraine.

title.children: JD Vance's Oval Office spray followed a long campaign against Ukraine aid

image.altText: A mosque, white in colour, with a police car and cops out the front of it.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old from Western Australia is under arrest following NSW Police launching a major investigation into a social media threat against a mosque in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Teen arrested after investigation into threat against Sydney mosque

image.altText: A woman sitting on a log wearing a brown top.

props.synopsis: The voices of those experiencing homelessness often go unheard. Meet three Canberrans who've found themselves sleeping rough. And while reasons for why differ for each, there's a common thread in how quickly and easily it happened.

title.children: 'All happened so quickly': Eileen is sleeping in her car at a Canberra park

image.altText: Bree and Kodi Nikorima pose

props.synopsis: The wife of Kodi Nikorima has slammed the NRL for prioritising the Dolphins season opening match against the Rabbitohs over the families of players in Brisbane, while Lions premiership player Lachie Neale said he would not have travelled if the AFL had relocated its game against Geelong.

title.children: 'Disgusting' NRL cyclone move slammed by Dolphin player's wife

image.altText: Jay-z 2025

props.synopsis: Jay-Z is suing all defendants for malicious prosecution, abuse of process, civil conspiracy and suing the anonymous woman for defamation.

title.children: Jay-Z sues woman and lawyers who dropped rape case

image.altText: three people in a space capsule

props.synopsis: The pair are waiting for their replacements to arrive at the International Space Station next week before they can check out.

title.children: Stranded US astronauts to return home after nine months in space

image.altText: An aerial view of a setting sun on a small settlement next to a tropical bay

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Country Liberal Party government was elected on a tough on crime mandate. The NT's biggest remote community is accusing it of overlooking that in the bush.

title.children: Remote NT community grappling with its own crime crisis

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and glasses leans confidently on the entrance to a white house

props.synopsis: It's almost impossible to know what advice to listen to and what to ignore, which is why we asked beloved, no-nonsense parenting author and educator Maggie Dent to share her wisdom.

title.children: From 'stay together for the kids' to 'routine is everything', Maggie Dent unpacks parenting advice

image.altText: A nuclear missile takes off.

props.synopsis: The number of nuclear weapons "available for use" continues to rise, with new research showing China, North Korea, India and Pakistan are increasing their stockpiles.

title.children: Number of deployable nuclear weapons has increased globally

image.altText: Two grey fighter jets fly side-by-side against a blue and lightly cloudy sky

props.synopsis: The plane and its pilots lost contact during an engagement with insurgents in the country's south.

title.children: Fighter pilots and their jet lose contact during mission against insurgents

image.altText: woman sits at computer

props.synopsis: The affordable pricing and simple process of direct-to-consumer DNA kits means curiosity around family and cultural heritage is tempting to satisfy. But are there costs to consumers that aren't financial?

title.children: Are you prepared for what an online ancestry DNA test might reveal?

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and solar panels.

props.synopsis: What Macquarie's departure from a global green alliance committed to cutting emissions tells us about the future of net zero finance.

title.children: Macquarie follows major US banks out the door of climate alliance
